title: Science Project-Based Learning Design Based on Higher-Order Thinking Skills for [K-12] Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational scientific principles and problem-solving methodologies
context.additional_context: A higher-order thinking skills enhancement program in science for vocational high school graduates, applying Anderson & Krathwohl’s (2001) taxonomy (factual, conceptual, procedural, metacognitive) to cultivate creative problem-solving abilities.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze scientific problems and propose creative solutions through conceptual connections.

Within one week, learners create a systematic data collection plan with ≥3 stages (measurement, classification, experimental design) to solve a corporate field problem (e.g., product quality inspection), visualize collected data in tables/graphs, and analyze two key patterns.
Learners use metacognitive strategies to evaluate their learning process and derive improvement plans.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
